sentences: Peer Raben (born Wilhelm Rabenbauer, 3 July 1940 – 21 January 2007) was a German composer who worked with German filmmaker Rainer Werner Fassbinder.
Raben was born in Viechtafell, Bavaria, and attended Musische Gymnasium Straubing.
He died of cancer in Mitterfels, Bavaria, Germany.
In 1966, Raben, together with several others, founded the Action Theatre in Munich, which led to the Anti Theatre in 1968, where he was active as writer, composer and director.
In 1969 and 1970 he produced Fassbinder’s first films.
